about.title: Shaping the Future of AI in Education
about.subtitle: AI Ethical Compass empowers students and educators to navigate the complex ethical landscape of artificial intelligence in education.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: AI Ethical Compass was developed for the ISTE+ASCD AI Innovator Challenge 2025 with a clear mission: to help high school students and educators develop critical thinking skills regarding the ethical, responsible, and inclusive use of Artificial Intelligence.
mission.additional: In a world where AI increasingly influences education and daily life, it's essential that young people and educators learn to navigate complex ethical questions about how these technologies should be used.

digitalInclusion.title: Digital Inclusion
digitalInclusion.content: Our platform examines how AI tools can either promote or hinder digital inclusion in educational contexts. We explore issues of access, equity, language barriers, and how AI might bridge or widen existing digital divides.

responsibleCitizenship.title: Responsible Digital Citizenship
responsibleCitizenship.content: Through our scenarios, users confront questions about responsible AI use, including transparency, disclosure, plagiarism concerns, privacy implications, and the development of ethical frameworks for emerging technologies.

sdg.title: UN Sustainable Development Goals
sdg.intro: Our platform aligns with multiple UN Sustainable Development Goals, with a particular emphasis on transforming education and reducing inequalities through ethical AI implementation. We believe that by addressing these core challenges, we can create a more equitable and inclusive future for all learners.

sdg4.title: SDG 4: Quality Education
sdg4.content: At the heart of our mission, we support SDG 4 by promoting critical analysis of how AI can enhance or detract from quality education. Our comprehensive scenarios examine ethical considerations that educators and students must navigate as AI becomes more prevalent in learning environments, ensuring that technological advancement serves educational excellence.

sdg10.title: SDG 10: Reduced Inequalities
sdg10.content: A fundamental pillar of our work, we address SDG 10 by deeply exploring how AI can either amplify or reduce inequalities. Our scenarios prompt users to consider algorithmic bias, accessibility considerations, and how AI design choices impact different populations, with a focus on creating more equitable educational opportunities.

sdg9.title: SDG 9: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure
sdg9.content: Our scenarios examine how AI innovation in education can be balanced with responsible development and inclusive access, ensuring that technological progress benefits all learners.

sdg16.title: SDG 16: Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions
sdg16.content: We explore how AI implementation affects institutional integrity, transparency, and justice in educational settings, promoting ethical frameworks and responsible governance.

sdg8.title: SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth
sdg8.content: Our scenarios consider how AI affects employment opportunities and skills development in education, preparing students for the evolving job market while ensuring fair and inclusive growth.

sdg3.title: SDG 3: Good Health and Well-being
sdg3.content: We examine how AI can support student well-being and mental health in educational settings, while addressing potential risks and ensuring a balanced approach to technology use.

getInvolved.title: Get Involved
getInvolved.content: Join educators and students worldwide in exploring the ethical dimensions of AI in education. Your perspective matters in shaping the future of responsible AI use.
